resources.textures

Class StaticTexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.textures.AbstractTexture
      • resources.textures.StaticTexture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource, ChangableColorSpace, EasyFiltering, Texture, Texture2D

    public class StaticTexture
extends AbstractTexture
implements EasyFiltering, ChangableColorSpace
    Stores data about a loaded texture. You can load a texture only once, if you try to load it twice, you get reference to the already loaded one.
    See Also:
    loadTexture(String path, boolean sRGB)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface resources.textures.EasyFiltering

      • loadTexture

        @NotNull
public static StaticTexture loadTexture(@NotNull
                                                  java.lang.String path,
                                                  boolean sRgb)
        Loads a texture from the given path. You can load a texture only once, if you try to load it twice, you get reference to the already loaded one.
        Parameters:
        path - texture's relative path (with extension like "res/textures/myTexture.png")
        sRgb - determines whether the texture is in sRGB color space
        Returns:
        texture

        Loads the texture's data from file to the RAM.

      • ramToVram

        private void ramToVram()
        Loads the texture's data from the RAM to the VRAM. It may cause errors if the data isn't in the RAM.

private void changeFiltering()

      • getVramTimeLimit

        public long getVramTimeLimit()
        Returns the VRAM time limit. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the texture's data may be removed from VRAM. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        VRAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setVramTimeLimit

        public void setVramTimeLimit(long vramTimeLimit)
        Sets the VRAM time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is RAM or HDD, the texture's data may be removed from VRAM. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        vramTimeLimit - VRAM time limit (in miliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - VRAM time limit have to be higher than 0 and lower than RAM time limit

      • getRamTimeLimit

        public long getRamTimeLimit()
        Returns the RAM time limit. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is HDD, the texture's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        RAM time limit (in miliseconds)

      • setRamTimeLimit

        public void setRamTimeLimit(long ramTimeLimit)
        Sets the RAM time limit to the given value. If the elapsed time since this texture's last use is higher than this value and the texture's data store policy is HDD, the texture's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        ramTimeLimit - RAM time limit (in miliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - RAM time limit have to be higher than VRAM time limit

      • getLastActive

        public long getLastActive()
        Returns the time when the texture last time used.
        Returns:
        the time when the texture last time used (in miliseconds)

      • getState

        @NotNull
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getState()
        Returns the texture's state. It determines where the texture is currently stored.
        Returns:
        the texture's state

      • getDataStorePolicy

        @NotNull
public ResourceManager.ResourceState getDataStorePolicy()
        Returns the texture's data store policy. VRAM means that the texture's data will be stored in VRAM. RAM means that the texture's data may be removed from VRAM to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the texture's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM if it's rarely used. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Returns:
        the texture's data store policy

      • setDataStorePolicy

        public void setDataStorePolicy(@NotNull
                               ResourceManager.ResourceState minState)
        Sets the texture's data store policy to the given value. VRAM means that the texture's data will be stored in VRAM. RAM means that the texture's data may be removed from VRAM to RAM if it's rarely used. HDD means that the texture's data may be removed from VRAM or even from RAM if it's rarely used. Later if you want to use this texture, it'll automatically load the data from file again.
        Parameters:
        minState - data store policy
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - minState can't be null

      • isDefaultsRgb

        public boolean isDefaultsRgb()
        Returns the texture's default color space. It doesn't have to be the same as the texture's current color space. You can load sRGB color space textures in linear space if you want (eg. if you don't want to use gamma correction).
        Returns:
        the texture's default color space
        See Also:
        issRgb(), setsRgb(boolean sRgb)

      • issRgb

        public boolean issRgb()
        Description copied from interface: Texture2D
        Determines whether the texture is in sRGB color space.
        Specified by:
        issRgb in interface Texture2D
        Returns:
        true if the texture's color space is sRGB, false otherwise

      • setsRgb

        public void setsRgb(boolean sRgb)
        Sets whether or not the texture is in sRGB color space. You can load sRGB color space textures in linear space if you want (eg. if you don't want to use gamma correction). But you can't change a default linear color space texture to sRGB color space because it's always used in linear color space. Note that this method reloads the texture from file if the color space changes.
        Specified by:
        setsRgb in interface ChangableColorSpace
        Parameters:
        sRgb - sRGB

      • isUsable

        public boolean isUsable()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Determines wheter this resource is usable. If it returns false, you can't use if for anything.
        Specified by:
        isUsable in interface Resource
        Returns:
        true if usable, false otherwise
